metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14681 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: The daemon in P3Scan 3.0_rc1 and earlier creates a p3scan.pid file after dropping privileges to a non-root account, which might allow local users to kill arbitrary processes by leveraging access to this non-root account for p3scan.pid modification before a root script executes a "kill `cat /pathname/p3scan.pid`" command, as demonstrated by etc/init.d/p3scan.

criterions.comment: p3scan: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
